pr_title: Add compatibility matrix for Jet and IMDG

timeline.message: add compatibility matrix for Jet and IMDG

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            When reading or writing to remote sources, Jet internally creates a
          
          
            
            client. This client uses the embedded IMDG version to connect to the
          
          
            
            remote cluster. Starting with Hazelcast 3.6, Hazelcast server & client
          
          
            
            versions are backward and forward compatible within the same major
          
          
            
            version.
          
          
            
            When reading or writing to remote IMDG cluster, Jet internally creates a
          
          
            
            Hazelcast client. This client has the same version as is the IMDG
          
          
            
            embedded with Jet. Starting with Hazelcast 3.6, Hazelcast server &
          
          
            
            client versions are backward and forward compatible within the same
          
          
            
            major version.
          
          
            
            
          
          
            
            The table below summarizes the IMDG versions embedded in each Jet version:
timeline.author: viliam-durina
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -899,6 +899,26 @@ p.readFrom(Sources.remoteMap("inputMap", cfg));
 ...
 ```
 
+#### Compatibility
+
+When reading or writing to remote sources, Jet internally creates a
+client. This client uses the embedded IMDG version to connect to the
+remote cluster. Starting with Hazelcast 3.6, Hazelcast server & client
+versions are backward and forward compatible within the same major
+version.

timeline.author: viliam-durina
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -899,6 +899,26 @@ p.readFrom(Sources.remoteMap("inputMap", cfg));
 ...
 ```
 
+#### Compatibility
+
+When reading or writing to remote sources, Jet internally creates a
+client. This client uses the embedded IMDG version to connect to the
+remote cluster. Starting with Hazelcast 3.6, Hazelcast server & client
+versions are backward and forward compatible within the same major
+version.
+
+|Jet Version|Embedded IMDG Version|CompatibleVersions|
+|:-----|:------------------|:-----------|
+|Jet 3.0|Hazelcast 3.12|Hazelcast 3.x.x|
+|Jet 3.1    |Hazelcast 3.12.1   |Hazelcast 3.x.x|
+|Jet 3.2    |Hazelcast 3.12.3   |Hazelcast 3.x.x|
+|Jet 3.2.1  |Hazelcast 3.12.5   |Hazelcast 3.x.x|
+|Jet 3.2.2  |Hazelcast 3.12.6   |Hazelcast 3.x.x|

timeline.bodyText: Hazelcast 4.x.x looks quite weird for me, should not we use just 4.x? or at least 4.x.y or 4.y.z?
timeline.author: olukas
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -899,6 +899,26 @@ p.readFrom(Sources.remoteMap("inputMap", cfg));
 ...
 ```
 
+#### Compatibility
+
+When reading or writing to remote sources, Jet internally creates a
+client. This client uses the embedded IMDG version to connect to the
+remote cluster. Starting with Hazelcast 3.6, Hazelcast server & client
+versions are backward and forward compatible within the same major
+version.
+
+|Jet Version|Embedded IMDG Version|CompatibleVersions|
+|:-----|:------------------|:-----------|
+|Jet 3.0|Hazelcast 3.12|Hazelcast 3.x.x|
+|Jet 3.1    |Hazelcast 3.12.1   |Hazelcast 3.x.x|
+|Jet 3.2    |Hazelcast 3.12.3   |Hazelcast 3.x.x|
+|Jet 3.2.1  |Hazelcast 3.12.5   |Hazelcast 3.x.x|
+|Jet 3.2.2  |Hazelcast 3.12.6   |Hazelcast 3.x.x|
+|Jet 4.0    |Hazelcast 4.0      |Hazelcast 4.x.x|
